story:
-Featured On-


      The Gadget Flow   The Techie Lifestyle

        Cool Wearable          Mike Shouts     

         tabliczni.pl     Belzino          

          Sakidori

Update #4.5 - Hardware Sneakpeak

Heres a quick sneakpeak and preview of the internals of Triband Plus! I wanted to do a one shot video and everything isn't perfect, but i hope that you like it :)





                                               

   BACKUP BATTERY                   CHARGING CABLE 


            

STORAGE DEVICE - OTG Compatible


FLASHLIGHT


                                                       

                                                      





The Main Idea

I started developing the Triband based on the amount of power we need to use in our daily life. While still in college, I would find myself with low power with my phone leaving me stranded without anyone to call. I would consider myself quite the forgetful fellow. 

Flash Drive Issue

I've always had a major issue keeping track of my flash drives, I've definitely lost over 20 flash drives over my 6 year long college career. Older projects have been lost which I could have used in my line of work, and redoing projects that i've lost in the process wasn't fun. I'd want to avoid having to run back and forth between my apartment and school/work.

Night Time Issue

I always loved the night, with the awesome shiny dots in the sky (we call em stars, in lion king, they're fireflies stuck in the sky. Those poor poor fireflies...), but sometimes it gets a little bit troublesome when walking down a dark alley way or getting things from your lightless garage. I've actually walked into a pole on my way home more than once (true story).


Ending Notes

In a way, this is a product I am making for myself back in the past. I am sure that Triband can help others whether it be school, work, camping, meetings, and other possible uses. But its always nice to have something conveniently located where you can grab it easily (you can stop looking through your backpack/bag/purse now).






 

 

Update #2.5 - Interactive 3D Model

Featured by our friends at SketchFab! Have fun viewing our 3D model over our campaign story :)





Make your Triband Plus 64 GB today!

Personalize your own Triband.


Unlock more colors.


Free audio recording upgrade for everyone.

Let's talk and find out what you would like to be added! Stretch goal 4 will be determined by the interest of the Triband Community! We will throw out possibilities and suggestions along the way and fine out what is possible as a 4th stretch goal!




             

We've kept the cost low on designing, R&D, and prototyping as we did mostly everything ourselves. The main cost will go to molding/tooling, mass production, and shipping.





Christopher Cheng

I graduated from San Jose State University Spring 2013 with a Computer Engineering BS. Since then (and during my time at SJSU), I've worked as a Field Application Engineer in home automation for over 3 years and another year in game development. I've taken a new turn to work as an entrepreneur/inventor as the creator of Triband Plus. Through my new taken experience, I've started designing, terrible videography, and animating all which make a really nice hobby (really fun too!).

The Team of Memes






I'll be covering milestones up until recently, this portion will update as we finish more on the product. I have neglected anything related to PR and marketing, and finding manufacturers and other helpful companies.

Designing the Triband(11/15/2014)

I've gone through a horrendous amount of iterations until i came to the final design of it. Here, take a look at some of these disasters.


Now here's the final design that went straight into 3D designing.


Hardware Prototype V1 Development (01/15/2015)


At this point, I have actually accomplished a lot! It seems like I'm so close to finishing this project. But of course, its never that simple.

You could charge a mobile phone, charge the Triband itself, but using it as a charging cable didn't work. Of course I had to do a complete redesign of the hardware to make it work (lame). Instead of spending more time, i've decided to find someone who can help with the overall redesign and even manufacture the hardware for us.

But during this time, we realized we need to get a 3D design and an Industrial Design in order to push our project further. The Industrial design could cause us to completely redesign the hardware and having to push through a higher R&D (research and development) cost [but it didn't].

3D Design (01/19/2015)

We probably should have worked on the 3D design first before moving on to hardware, or at least have both working at the same time, but the Industrial design may cause us to redesign anyways. Its hard to say when we actually have to had start the hardware design. But since we have the hardware already working, we have proved that the Triband can potentially work as a product for all the end consumers.

I present to you our next milestone! We are moving forward, and that is the most important thing that you can do with any project.


Industrial Design (02/10/2015)

We've finally got our Industrial design finished, and somehow the size of our PCB board fits in perfectly. Though we had to make changes to the size of the battery multiple times before we got this right. With this, we can define the cost of molding the Triband for the final stage of development.


Non-working Prototype (03/15/2015)

For marketing purposes, we developed a non-working prototype. I was so happy to get this in my hand as it was like bringing up a baby into growth. Though it doesn't work, I can't wait to have a working prototype on hand (you would have seen most of our pictures were taken with this prototype, but the plastic lock broke after a month of use, but no worries! We'll be using an aluminum lock which should last forever).


Hardware Prototype V2 (05/05/15)

We've finished the final version of the hardware that will go into the working prototype. We won't start it right away since there is so much to do before hand. But here are some images! I will be posting videos later on to show off all the functions sometimes in the middle of our campaign!


(Timelines based on a perfect release with no problems).
Mass Production (OCTOBER/NOVEMBER)
Ship to Backers (DECEMBER)

Backers Receive Triband (DECEMBER/JANUARY)

 



 


Production and Quality Assurance

During production, anything can happen. From parts not fitting in right, terrible assembly of our product. We'll have to push up some trust and hope that none of these happens through our current team.

There is a second problem associated to production, we have found out that our product will be very hard to put together without damaging it due to the nature of having the FPC wires in the band. It is projected that there will be a fail rate of 10 - 20% during the injection mold phase of assembly. We are looking for a injection molding company right now that is confident in putting our product together. (At some point, I believe one of the companies have tried to trick me with their extremely low price!)

After molding and assembling the final product, we'll run a burn test (20 hours of various tests) on all Triband Go Companion assembled to ensure that every single product is working before being shipped out to our backers. Safety and quality is our number one priority!

Shipment 2 Backers

Shipping is always complicated when it comes to shipping multiple projects. Things can go wrong, packages go missing, and many complaints filed.

Though finding someone who will be able to handle all the shipment and figure out the logistics helps! With the help of one of the guys in the team, he has massive knowledge on shipping packages to everywhere in the world. He is one hard worker, and we are slowly figuring out the logistics of shipping as we go. If any packages didn't seem to make it to its destination, contact us and let us know so we can make things right and find out what happened.




If you love the idea, but you have, cannot, or will not contribute at this moment, please help us spread the idea to your family and friends who may be interested. Our success is based on you, your family, or friend for the Triband!

 

Let make some noise and help me make this the best wearable band you can ever get.

If you are still interested in our campaign, click on the button and sign up for the newsletter and we'll let you know when we release our campaign, or any additional updates.

This is the end! Thanks for your interest!

story:
Available in September 2015 here!

Design

Everyone loves "Mini". And we like it too. But sometimes, we need more power, more freedom of choice, more opportunities, and for better price. With DNK-H PC case, you can organize fully customizable mini-server, router, network storage, HTPC system, media server, security system, as well as powerful computer to perform any tasks. Without limits! To achieve these results, we have chosen compatibility with smallest size, but powerfull - Thin Mini-ITX desktop boards.

Design benefits:

  • The world's most compact PC case design - 200 x 200 x 53 mm.
  • The only one Desktop PC case, in small form-factor, with built-in Power Supply.
  • Cooling System, which cools not only the CPU, but the whole system.
  • Ready to take onboard the latest generation of Intel CPUs Broadwell and Skylake, with great Gaming Experience.
  • Up to 2 storage drivers. HDD or SSD 2.5' + mSATA SSD.
  • Simple and reliable PC Case design.
  • DNK-H PC case provides possibility of mounting on the wall.

Cooling system

Usually, in cooling systems, the air enters inside, heats up the other computer components. We know, that it's affect the lifetime of hard drives, as well as other system components. And we have made things differently. In DNK-H PC case, cold air first passed through the whole case, cools down all system components, and only after that - immediately blown out. Also, we are clearly separated incoming and outgoing airflows. It makes possible to cool down all the internal components, as well as CPUs with TDP up to 84W.

Cooling fan is PWM controlled with 900-4200prm, from the leader of PC fans production - "ID-Cooling":

The successful arrangement of the air vents, allowing to arrange the DNK-H PC case in any position. A vertically on a wall, or on one side, or one on another. In any case, it does not block the airflow and does not affect the efficiency of the cooling.

Internal Power Supply

We decided to integrate the Power Supply into the case not only because it is convenient. We did this, because of reliability and durability. The fact, that the external power supplies do not have their own cooling system. That's why they have a short lifespan under a high power load. In DNK-H PC case the successful arrangement of the Power Supply (exactly in the place where constantly circulates cold air), allows us to say with certainty, that even at the nominal output power all components of Power Supply working at rated state. This able to ensure long-term continuous operation. Very long...

Tech Specs

  • Overall dimensions:  200 х 200 х 53 mm
  • Net weight: 960g (1120g with Aluminum Top Cover)
  • Power Supply: AC 100-230v / DC 19v / 150W. Efficiency up to 88%.
  • Compatibility: *Thin Mini-ITX Desktop Boards
  • Cooling System: Active. Fan speed 900-4200prm. PWM controlled.
  • Wireless interfaces: Internal or external WI-FI antennas
  • Storage media: HDD or SSD 2.5’ in case + mSATA on Motherboard
  • Noise level: 38db at maximum fan speed
  • LEDs: White and Green LEDs
*Please take a note, that some Thin Mini-ITX motherboards don't have internal connector for 19.5v DC input (Molex 5566-02A). In this case, you can solder this connector manually (connector included), or use DNK-H PC case with External Power Supply (not included).

Package Contents:

  • DNK-H PC case with built-in Power Supply and Cooling System
  • Signal SATA cable, power SATA cable
  • Connectors for external WI-FI antennas
  • AC power cord

Test Results

We spent many months to test the entire system, and we can assure you, that all components work together as one. Like in no other system, at the maximum CPU load, the other components become colder. Unbelievable, but it's true. For example, we provide system stability test, which is included in the AIDA64 program:

In this test we used Intel Core i7-3770 processor with TDP 77W. After fifteen minute test at 100% CPU load, the temperature of Hard Drive and RAM modules does not changed and CPU Package temperature - at normal state.

In the regular working tests, like image and video editing, internet browsing, office working, as well as gaming experience test system works completely quiet:

ADDITIONAL IMAGES:

WITH ALUMINUM TOP COVER:

Additional design benefits:

  • Plastic parts made of polycarbonate - for high strength.
  • Aluminum top cover glass beads blasting and clear anodized.
  • All parts of the case follows a curved design concept. All. Internal too.
  • No screws or rivets on the exterior.
  • All internal fasteners of the same size - for ease of assembling.
  • Ultra quiet when performing common tasks.

Table of funding allocation

What next?

Right now, this project is ready to start production. But we don't have a main ingredient for it's successful implementation. This ingredient is your support. After graduating from fundraising, we are ready to immediately start production. This will allow us, already in July, to start sending product to customers.
story_txt:
Available in September 2015 here!
Design
Everyone loves "Mini". And we like it too. But sometimes, we need more power, more freedom of choice, more opportunities, and for better price. With DNK-H PC case, you can organize fully customizable mini-server, router, network storage, HTPC system, media server, security system, as well as powerful computer to perform any tasks. Without limits! To achieve these results, we have chosen compatibility with smallest size, but powerfull - Thin Mini-ITX desktop boards.
Design benefits:

The world's most compact PC case design - 200 x 200 x 53 mm.
The only one Desktop PC case, in small form-factor, with built-in Power Supply.
Cooling System, which cools not only the CPU, but the whole system.
Ready to take onboard the latest generation of Intel CPUs Broadwell and Skylake, with great Gaming Experience.
Up to 2 storage drivers. HDD or SSD 2.5' + mSATA SSD.

Simple and reliable PC Case design.
DNK-H PC case provides possibility of mounting on the wall.










Cooling systemUsually, in cooling systems, the air enters inside, heats up the other computer components. We know, that it's affect the lifetime of hard drives, as well as other system components. And we have made things differently. In DNK-H PC case, cold air first passed through the whole case, cools down all system components, and only after that - immediately blown out. Also, we are clearly separated incoming and outgoing airflows. It makes possible to cool down all the internal components, as well as CPUs with TDP up to 84W.


Cooling fan is PWM controlled with 900-4200prm, from the leader of PC fans production - "ID-Cooling":




The successful arrangement of the air vents, allowing to arrange the DNK-H PC case in any position. A vertically on a wall, or on one side, or one on another. In any case, it does not block the airflow and does not affect the efficiency of the cooling.


Internal Power Supply
We decided to integrate the Power Supply into the case not only because it is convenient. We did this, because of reliability and durability. The fact, that the external power supplies do not have their own cooling system. That's why they have a short lifespan under a high power load. In DNK-H PC case the successful arrangement of the Power Supply (exactly in the place where constantly circulates cold air), allows us to say with certainty, that even at the nominal output power all components of Power Supply working at rated state. This able to ensure long-term continuous operation. Very long...










Tech Specs




Overall dimensions:  200 х 200 х 53 mm


Net weight: 960g (1120g with Aluminum Top Cover)


Power Supply: AC 100-230v / DC 19v / 150W. Efficiency up to 88%.


Compatibility: *Thin Mini-ITX Desktop Boards


Cooling System: Active. Fan speed 900-4200prm. PWM controlled.


Wireless interfaces: Internal or external WI-FI antennas


Storage media: HDD or SSD 2.5’ in case + mSATA on Motherboard


Noise level: 38db at maximum fan speed


LEDs: White and Green LEDs







*Please take a note, that some Thin Mini-ITX motherboards don't have internal connector for 19.5v DC input (Molex 5566-02A). In this case, you can solder this connector manually (connector included), or use DNK-H PC case with External Power Supply (not included).

Package Contents:

DNK-H PC case with built-in Power Supply and Cooling System
Signal SATA cable, power SATA cable
Connectors for external WI-FI antennas
AC power cord



Test Results






We spent many months to test the entire system, and we can assure you, that all components work together as one. Like in no other system, at the maximum CPU load, the other components become colder. Unbelievable, but it's true. For example, we provide system stability test, which is included in the AIDA64 program:



In this test we used Intel Core i7-3770 processor with TDP 77W. After fifteen minute test at 100% CPU load, the temperature of Hard Drive and RAM modules does not changed and CPU Package temperature - at normal state.
In the regular working tests, like image and video editing, internet browsing, office working, as well as gaming experience test system works completely quiet:


ADDITIONAL IMAGES:









WITH ALUMINUM TOP COVER:






Additional design benefits:





Plastic parts made of polycarbonate - for high strength.

Aluminum top cover glass beads blasting and clear anodized.
All parts of the case follows a curved design concept. All. Internal too.
No screws or rivets on the exterior.
All internal fasteners of the same size - for ease of assembling.
Ultra quiet when performing common tasks.

Table of funding allocation





What next?
Right now, this project is ready to start production. But we don't have a main ingredient for it's successful implementation. This ingredient is your support. After graduating from fundraising, we are ready to immediately start production. This will allow us, already in July, to start sending product to customers.

story:
EndlessWine is a wine rack, that senses when a bottle has been removed, and alerts you via mobile app to re-order that bottle.  Then let's you do exactly that...automatically.

The Pain...OH the Pain!!! Ugh!

Like most inventions, EndlessWine was born out of a painful moment....

We first came up with the idea for Endless Wine when we were hanging out with a few friends one weekend, drinking wine, having a great time, and we went to reach for another bottle of wine....But much to our embarrassment...we had finished the last bottle. We had been so busy all week with work and life in general that we had forgotten to restock our wine supply. We thought "Wouldn't it be awesome if the Wine Rack was smart enough to re-stock itself?"

So we went to work on the concept and invention of Endless Wine. We think the world is now a better place! :)

The concept is simple really:

1st....we start with a simple 5 position wooden construction wine rack.

THEN...we add the technology magic....

Position sensors transmit empty Wine slots via a Wifi Connection to a server-side application that notifies you on your mobile device to reorder the wine for that slot. 

The mobile app enables you do do exactly that, in real-time.  Never forget to stay fully stocked, and NEVER have a "last bottle" again.




You populate the  Tasting Queue by pre-shopping for a list of wines that you want to try.  When you drink one bottle in your Tasting Queue, the next bottle in your queue gets re-ordered automatically.

Here's are all the reasons to Love us:

  • Available ONLY in the USA
  • Made in the USA
  • Programmed in the USA
  • 5 Refillable Wine Position
  • Patent pending
  • Wifi enabled
  • FREE Wine Re-Ordering App is Available for both Apple and Android devices


What People are Saying:

"Now THIS app might be reason enough for me to get a smarter phone! LOL" – Mary Hamilton

"I’ve never heard of a better idea!" – Justin A Turner

"I think that this new product is a smashing idea." – Mo’ Vino Journey



Risks & Challenges

One of the major challenges we face with this project is that we rely on a 3rd party wine distributor to deliver the wine.

Since we are not a wine retailer or distribution house ourselves, we need to have and maintain a relationship with a 3rd party partner to do fulfillment for us.  This is why we are programming our app to be "Product Catalog Agnostic".  Meaning, since there are dozens of wine distributors in the United States who would LOVE to get in on this, we want our app to be flexible enough to work with any of them.  This way we are less reliant on any one business relationship in order to be successful.

FAQ'S

Q: Can I buy EndlessWine if I don't live in the USA?
A: We have this crowdfund disabled for users foreign to the USA.  This is mostly because our wine distribution partner only ships to the USA.  As we get distribution partners in other countries, we will open up sales of the Units to those countries.

Q:  Is there anything special I need to make EndlessWine work in my house?
A:  You need wifi access so that the rack can communicate via the internet with the ordering program.  You need an Android or Apple Smartphone in order to download and install the free companion app. Also, the rack needs to be plugged in.  So you'll need a power outlet near where you plan to keep your rack.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to support us financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  Help us now by doing one of the following:

1.  Tell every single (living) wine drinking human you know about this.  Post it on all the social media outlets you can (use the Indiegogo tools for this).
2.  Comment on this page.  Tell us what you think.
3.  The next time you have a glass of wine....think about us :)

story:
Our company, MJ Technology, has a mission to bring innovative, high quality hardware and software to the market at an increased value for you the consumer. Our MJ Technology Linux Tablet series is just one example.

Led by our two company founders, we are a team of eight developers who have a combined knowledge base of over 50 years in the mobile technology fields. Our company has already brought one product to the market, our MJ7HDTV Android HDTV Tuner tablet, so we have the experience of designing, testing, and bringing to market a complete product.

Our plan now is to bring to the world market a tablet specifically designed and tailored for the Linux operating system, not only for use by the avid Linux user, but also for the everyday user, thus bringing the benefits of Linux to people around the world.

Our goal is to make a superior tablet, both in build quality and hardware performance. This lets consumers then decide how they can utilize it to their best advantage. Whether that is a dual boot Windows 10/Open SUSE Linux system for a system administrator needing to manage multiple servers remotely, or just Open SUSE Linux as your sole operating system for personal use, we have a tablet that will fit your needs.

We are seeking $200,000.00 to bring this product to final production. We have prototype tablets built and are in final design testing and debug stages to make ready for production. We have shown proof that our tablets are real, and will work with multiple Linux distributions, via the videos we have posted on our Facebook and YouTube channels during the development stages.

We are ready to go forward with final production at this point, and are asking for your support, to help us make the World’s First actual Made-for- Linux x86/x64 Tablet a reality.

We want the user to have the choice of what operating system and software they want for their given application. Even if a user would like multiple operating systems on one tablet, such as Open SUSE Linux, Elementary OS, Linux Mint, Red Hat, Ubuntu ,or Kali Linux, we can provide the user with the options they need.


We will assist them in that respect by working on making all known viable, popular Linux distributions compatible with our Linux tablets. It will take time to integrate the different Linux distributions shown above, as each has unique properties, but that is our end goal here at MJ Technology LLC.

The first Linux OS to be installed on our tablet by default will be the latest stable version of Open SUSE Leap or Ubuntu Desktop 16.04 LTS with the most current version of Unity/Mir window manager.

Open SUSE Linux and Ubuntu Linux  is the mostly widely used and recognized consumer-oriented Linux distributions to date, therefore it was the most logical choice to start our tablet development with. This allows the user immediate access to the hundreds of thousands of applications/games already available on Linux.

Once Ubuntu Touch is to a released state, we will provide an installable image built for our tablet, with instructions via our website so the consumer can upgrade/install the OS themselves, or with our tech support assistance if needed.

Our goal has always been a true Linux x86/x64 Tablet/PC  with true convergence of use across multiple devices being the end goal, just as Canonical has shown with Ubuntu Touch, but with the added bonus of being x86/x64 base with no compatibility issues or need of porting/redevelopment of software from x86 base to ARM base.

We want to put the power and control of the computer back in the user’s hands.

MJ Technology presents our "Warrior" series of Tablets. Pledge for one today here on IndieGoGo and join "The Way of the Enlightened Warrior." Please take a moment to review the specifications below of each model in our Tablet series, and begin your journey on the enlightened path.

After hearing concerns expressed by some people about the initial pricing of the tablets with the higher performance level hardware, we have responded quickly to them and have come up with an additional mid-range model.

While providing mid-range level hardware, it will still provide an excellent user experience. It comes with the same case/multiple ports/display/battery and will function as just well as our other models for user not requiring the stronger performing hardware.

Below is what the 8.9 inch (on left) and 10.1 inch (on right) models will look like, each model coming with two available color options, matte black or a brushed aluminum finish. See our website for the optional matching tablet that provides for a true 2-in-1 Ultrabook experience.


Here is a comparison of specifications between our MJ Technology Ubuntu Tablet and the BQ M10 Ubuntu Touch Tablet. The BQ M10 will only run Ubuntu Touch and Touch related software natively, as it uses an ARM processor. For better view and comparison to other tablets like Microsoft Surface Pro 4 and Dell Venue 8 Pro Please click on the link just below.

Click Here for Comparison Sheets to compare our tablets to others tablets...


Click here for pictures of Ubuntu 16.04 LTS Mate Final running on Mini Tanto...
This precludes it from running Ubuntu Desktop, or any other x86/x64 based distribution of Linux natively therefore an emulation API will have to be used. You can be the judge, but we feel we have surpassed the BQ M10 with our tablet design that is a true multi-use system from the start.

Some people will ask  “What does using Linux as your operating system provide you, the user, over other operating systems”?


Linux provides multiple advantages:

Cost – The most obvious advantage of using Linux is the fact that it is free, to obtain and use, while Microsoft and other products are available for a hefty, and sometimes, recurring fee. Microsoft licensed software is typically only allowed to be installed on a single computer, where as a Linux distribution and the related software can be installed on any number of computers, without paying a single dime.

Security – In line with the costs advantage, the system security aspects of Linux is much stronger and robust than that of Windows. Why should you have to spend extra money for anti-virus protection software, taking up CPU time, memory, and disk space?

The Linux operating system has been around since the early nineties and has managed to stay secure in the face of widespread viruses, spyware and adware for all these years. It is modeled after UNIX software, which is run around the world in multiple business and universities, and was designed from the beginning with security as a prime function.

While the argument has been made by some that Linux not being widely used compared to other operating systems is a reason for there being few known viruses able to attach it, it is more the way Linux is constructed internally that precludes easy infection and spread of computer viruses.

The Linux operating system is open source and if there were a widespread Linux virus released today, there would be patches released in a matter of hours or a few days, either by ordinary people that use the operating system or by the distribution maintainers. You wouldn’t need to wait for a patch from a single company like we do with some operating systems, that could take weeks or months maybe possibly years in some cases.

Choice (Freedom) – The power of choice is a great Linux advantage. With Linux, you have the power to control just about every aspect of the operating system. Two major features the user can control are the look and feel of their desktop by way of numerous Window Managers, and the kernel, which controls the computer hardware. In Windows, you’re either stuck using the boring default desktop themes, or risk possible corruption or failure by installing a third-party shell. By controlling the kernel, the user can fine-tune their system for the way they work, not relying on a generic, one-size fits all usage pattern.

Software - There are so many software choices when it comes to doing any specific task, be it system admin, multi-media creation, education, you name it. If you need a specific program, you will probably find one or more that will work for you. You could search for a basic text editor from multiple sources at once, and yield hundreds, if not thousands of results.

Regular users and programmers contribute applications all the time. Sometimes it’s a simple modification or feature enhancement of an already existing piece of software, sometimes it’s a brand new application. In addition, software on Linux tends to be packed with more features and greater usability than software on Windows.

Best of all, the vast majority of Linux software is free and open source. Not only are you getting the software at no charge to you, but if you have a problem or an idea for an improvement, you can make a request to the software developers directly for them to make the changes. Another option, if you understand the programming language, is you, the end-user can modify the source code yourself and add more functions or fix problems. By contributing your changes to the source code back to the Linux community, you are improving the software for everyone.


What more could you, the user, ask for?

In the coming days, we will be posting some videos in Comments section and Gallery explaining our vision for our tablets, plus showing some working preview examples of what is to come in the next few months when the tablets are available for delivery.

See our Facebook page as we will be posting continuing updates on the final testing and development progress.

                    https://www.facebook.com/MJ-Technology-LLC-576568032444682/

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_bXAqtExCIQSsozIBwJLbA


Below are some News/Media outlets that have referenced our upcoming tablet release:

You can also do a search online to find out about our Ubuntu Tablet, just do a keyword search "MJ Technology Ubuntu".

Please join our vision, and support our work, as we strive toward providing the best possible Linux experience for all consumers, with a portable, powerful, and useful tablet now, and more devices in the future.

Risks & Challenges:

1.  Failed past Linux/Ubuntu Projects - We totally understand everyone’s apprehensions since the Jolla and Ubutab incidents and the fact it has made everyone very cautious is something we take very seriously here at MJ Technology.

Jolla just needed to be upfront: the money and development focus was on the Sailfish OS and the hardware was an afterthought, not a priority for their campaign here on Indiegogo.

Ubutab on the other hand was an outright scam from the beginning. There were telling signs: nothing but rendered pictures, outlandish published specs, no plan stated on how to market or sell the tablet (at a profit) as the hardware used would cost more than they were asking for it, which meant no future development and no support after the campaign was done.

Finally the biggest problem was the people involved in making the campaign did not have any experience designing or manufacturing a small scale or mass-produced product, and the campaign was led by a person with no technology field experience or manufacturing background.

We developed and have brought to market one device already, the MJ7HDTV Android HDTV Tuner tablet. We are close to 95% or better complete with the new Linux tablets, and just need funds to make the production of them happen.

The MJ Technology Ubuntu Tablet is based on existing hardware, not something developed from scratch, like a new processor type or something like that. The hardware is based on proven components, and we are assembling them using standard practices.

The unique thing is the OS, which is based on existing software (Ubuntu and other Linux distro's) we have developed to work with the hardware we have built. So we are bringing a new product to market, but using proven software and hardware, plus we have a proven track record of delivering the expected product like our MJ7HDTV Tablet.

MJ Technology’s project is an “all or nothing” campaign, unlike Ubutab’s which was a “flex payment” campaign. This meant no matter what happened, they would get the campaign money whether they could deliver the product or not.

Our development team has the knowledge and the desire to complete this project. If you look at our progress updates and videos on our Facebook page, you will see we have had the option to try and raise the money for some time. We chose not to do this until we had a proven hardware/software configuration finalized and were ready to take the last steps to move to the production phase.

That time is NOW! Please show your support, whether it is making a pledge for one of our tablets or just spreading the word to others who might be interested via social media or word of mouth.  Let’s make a true Linux tablet, created by avid users, available for everyone, a reality…

2.  Can we produce the tablet as described? - We have worked on a similar device, our MJ7HDTV Tablet since August 2014 and released it to market in October 2015. This is why we have a complete confidence in our ability to successfully deliver this product.


We could really use your comments, suggestions, concerns about our Ubuntu Tablet project the MJ Technology Warrior Tablet Series. Please e-mail us @ comments@mj-technology.com  So we can address any and all concerns you might have about project we have not addressed as of yet with videos, pictures, and our mission statment here on IndieGoGo.

We have an experienced team, very skilled both with hardware and software integration. We are absolutely confident that we can ship this Ubuntu Linux Tablet according to our projected timeline.  We have already completed and tested several models of the prototype using the old Intel’s Bay Trail Processor when we first started development and now with the Intel Cherry Trail processor.

This has helped us to not only gain thorough, component-specific knowledge to aid in development and design of this tablet, but has allowed us to build solid and professional relationships with all of the component suppliers involved in the future production process.

We understand that there are a few risks associated with the launch of a brand new technology product into the world market, but we are convinced that with our design, these are minimal and manageable. We already have in our hands a complete, functioning product, and we are ready to mass-produce it for you the consumer.

We believe in a transparent project management approach, thus we have chosen to keep all our backers informed on a regular basis about the progress made during the production phase, just as we have during the hardware/software development phase, through our Facebook page.

  https://www.facebook.com/MJ-Technology-LLC-576568032444682/

Mark Jun - Co-founder of MJ Technology the company working on The Ubuntu tablet you see here and co-creator of the MJ7HDTV Android HDTV Tuner Tablet. Mark has twenty years in the portable electronics manufacturing hardware/software design and team management. He is also an experienced Linux Developer specializing in Linux driver and kernel development.

Edmond Wang - CEO of the leading manufacturer of tablets and wearable device in China/USA, which produce more than 2 millions tablet annually .More than 20 years working experience in IT industry,  Edmond lead a BIT team to do the OEM/ODM work for the customers more than 30 countries. He brings a wealth of marketing knowledge and management of distribution for the team.

Jason Guo - Electronics Engineer/Designer with 12 years working experience  on intel PCB design, he has worked as senior hardware engineer for Philips and Creative.

Reckon - Engineer/Developer with 20 years experience as a Android/Linux developer and electrical engineer for a OEM/ODM Manufacturer. Reckon specializes in Linux Driver/Kernel development and electrical design.

Oni - Experienced Linux Developer specializing in Linux driver and kernel development his focus on the project has been the touch screen.


Jon - Experienced Linux Developer specializing in Linux driver and kernel development his focus has been on optimization of the kernel and drivers.

around since the early nineties and has managed to stay secure in the face of
widespread viruses, spyware and adware for all these years. It is modeled after
UNIX software, which is run around the world in multiple business and universities,
and was designed from the beginning with security as a prime function.
While the argument has been made by
some that Linux not being widely used compared to other operating systems is a
reason for there being few known viruses able to attach it, it is more the way
Linux is constructed internally that precludes easy infection and spread of
computer viruses.
The Linux operating system is open
source and if there were a widespread Linux virus released today, there would
be patches released in a matter of hours or a few days, either by ordinary
people that use the operating system or by the distribution maintainers. You
wouldn’t need to wait for a patch from a single company like we do with some
operating systems, that could take weeks or months maybe possibly years in some
cases.Choice (Freedom) – The power of choice is a great Linux advantage. With
Linux, you have the power to control just about every aspect of the operating
system. Two major features the user can control are the look and feel of their
desktop by way of numerous Window Managers, and the kernel, which controls the
computer hardware. In Windows, you’re either stuck using the boring default
desktop themes, or risk possible corruption or failure by installing a
third-party shell. By controlling the kernel, the user can fine-tune their
system for the way they work, not relying on a generic, one-size fits all usage
pattern.Software - There are so many software choices when it comes to doing
any specific task, be it system admin, multi-media creation, education, you
name it. If you need a specific program, you will probably find one or more
that will work for you. You could search for a basic text editor from multiple
sources at once, and yield hundreds, if not thousands of results.

Regular users and programmers
contribute applications all the time. Sometimes it’s a simple modification or
feature enhancement of an already existing piece of software, sometimes it’s a
brand new application. In addition, software on Linux tends to be packed with
more features and greater usability than software on Windows.
Best of all, the vast majority of
Linux software is free and open source. Not only are you getting the software
at no charge to you, but if you have a problem or an idea for an improvement,
you can make a request to the software developers directly for them to make the
changes. Another option, if you understand the programming language, is you,
the end-user can modify the source code yourself and add more functions or fix
problems. By contributing your changes to the source code back to the Linux
community, you are improving the software for everyone.
What more could you, the user, ask
for?
In the coming days, we will be
posting some videos in Comments section and Gallery explaining our vision for our tablets, plus showing some
working preview examples of what is to come in the next few months when the
tablets are available for delivery.
See our Facebook page as we will be
posting continuing updates on the final testing and development progress.                    https://www.facebook.com/MJ-Technology-LLC-576568032444682/https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_bXAqtExCIQSsozIBwJLbABelow are some News/Media outlets
that have referenced our upcoming tablet release: You can also do a search online to
find out about our Ubuntu Tablet, just do a keyword search "MJ Technology
Ubuntu".

Please join our vision, and support
our work, as we strive toward providing the best possible Linux experience for
all consumers, with a portable, powerful, and useful tablet now, and more
devices in the future.
Risks
& Challenges:
1. 
Failed
past Linux/Ubuntu Projects - We totally understand everyone’s
apprehensions since the Jolla and Ubutab incidents and the fact it has made
everyone very cautious is something we take very seriously here at MJ
Technology.
Jolla just needed to be upfront: the money and development focus was on the
Sailfish OS and the hardware was an afterthought, not a priority for their
campaign here on Indiegogo.
Ubutab on the other hand was an outright scam from the beginning. There were
telling signs: nothing but rendered pictures, outlandish published specs, no
plan stated on how to market or sell the tablet (at a profit) as the hardware
used would cost more than they were asking for it, which meant no future
development and no support after the campaign was
done.
Finally the biggest problem was the people involved in making the campaign did
not have any experience designing or manufacturing a small scale or mass-produced
product, and the campaign was led by a person with no technology field experience
or manufacturing background.
We developed and have brought to market one device already, the MJ7HDTV
Android HDTV Tuner tablet. We are close to 95% or better complete with the new Linux
tablets, and just need funds to make the production of them happen.
The MJ Technology Ubuntu Tablet is based on existing hardware, not something
developed from scratch, like a new processor type or something like that. The
hardware is based on proven components, and we are assembling them using
standard practices.
The unique thing is the OS, which is based on existing software (Ubuntu and
other Linux distro's) we have developed to work with the hardware we have
built. So we are bringing a new product to market, but using proven software
and hardware, plus we have a proven track record of delivering the expected
product like our MJ7HDTV Tablet.
MJ Technology’s project is an “all or nothing” campaign, unlike Ubutab’s
which was a “flex payment” campaign. This meant no matter what happened, they
would get the campaign money whether they could deliver the product or not. 
Our development team has the knowledge and the desire to complete this
project. If you look at our progress updates and videos on our Facebook page,
you will see we have had the option to try and raise the money for some time.
We chose not to do this until we had a proven hardware/software configuration finalized
and were ready to take the last steps to move to the production phase. 
That time is NOW! Please show your support, whether it is making a
pledge for one of our tablets or just spreading the word to others who might be
interested via social media or word of mouth. 
Let’s make a true Linux tablet, created by avid users, available for
everyone, a reality…
2. 
Can we
produce the tablet as described? - We have worked on a similar device, our MJ7HDTV Tablet since August 2014
and released it to market in October 2015. This is why we have a complete
confidence in our ability to successfully deliver this product. 
We could really use your comments, suggestions, concerns about our 
Ubuntu Tablet project the MJ Technology Warrior Tablet Series. Please 
e-mail us @  comments@mj-technology.com  So we can address any 
and all concerns you might have about project we have not addressed as 
of yet with videos, pictures, and our mission statment here on IndieGoGo.We have an experienced team, very
skilled both with hardware and software integration. We are absolutely
confident that we can ship this Ubuntu Linux Tablet according to our projected timeline.  We have already completed and tested several
models of the prototype using the old Intel’s Bay Trail Processor when we first
started development and now with the Intel Cherry Trail processor. 
This has helped us to not only gain
thorough, component-specific knowledge to aid in development and design of this
tablet, but has allowed us to build solid and professional relationships with
all of the component suppliers involved in the future production process.
We understand that there are a few risks associated
with the launch of a brand new technology product into the world market, but we
are convinced that with our design, these are minimal and manageable. We
already have in our hands a complete, functioning product, and we are ready to
mass-produce it for you the consumer. 
We believe in a transparent project management
approach, thus we have chosen to keep all our backers informed on a regular
basis about the progress made during the production phase, just as we have
during the hardware/software development phase, through our Facebook page.  https://www.facebook.com/MJ-Technology-LLC-576568032444682/Mark Jun - Co-founder of MJ Technology the 
company working on The Ubuntu tablet you see here and co-creator of the MJ7HDTV Android
 HDTV Tuner Tablet. Mark has twenty years in the portable electronics manufacturing hardware/software design and team management. He is also an experienced Linux Developer specializing in Linux driver and kernel development.Edmond Wang - CEO of the leading manufacturer of tablets and wearable 
device in China/USA, which produce more than 2 millions tablet annually 
.More than 20 years working experience in IT industry,  Edmond lead a BIT 
team to do the OEM/ODM work for the customers more than 30 countries. He brings a wealth of marketing knowledge and management of distribution for the team.Jason Guo - Electronics Engineer/Designer with 12 years working experience  on intel PCB 
design, he has worked as senior hardware engineer for Philips and 
Creative.Reckon - Engineer/Developer with 20 years experience as
 a Android/Linux developer and electrical engineer for a OEM/ODM 
Manufacturer. Reckon specializes in Linux Driver/Kernel development and electrical 
design.Oni - Experienced Linux Developer specializing in Linux driver and kernel development his focus on the project has been the touch screen.Jon - Experienced Linux Developer specializing in Linux driver and kernel development his focus has been on optimization of the kernel and drivers.

story:
Why are we doing this?

SwipeBoard is an idea that allows you to look at the text inputting from a different angle. It solves a number of issues that regular software keyboard has:

·      To fit the screen, key buttons should be small enough

·      Keyboard takes a large part of the screen

·      You make mistakes pretty often

·      Eye-free text inputting is not supported

·      You have to change the way you hold your phone if you need to text with only one hand.

There is still no good solution for TV, Smart Watch and Gamepads at all.

The Idea

To understand the idea, it is better to watch the video, but in short, instead of making you tap key buttons on a regular software keyboard, SwipeBoard matches a swipe direction over the screen with a particular letter. As a result, you need to allocate smaller part of a screen, user doesn’t have to be as accurate (hence, typing speed increases), eye-free text inputting is supported (so people with eye-disabilities can use it as well).

The biggest power of the idea is that any part of touch surface can become a keyboard for you, starting from Apple Watch, ending with a touch surface on a steering wheel of your car (should be an interesting case with the autopilot in Tesla, right?).

Why do we need money?

Currently, we have pretty good prototypes for Android and iOS that implement the idea. Unfortunately, as we have main jobs, we can only work on the project in our personal time that makes development rather slow.

Here is what we need to complete a production ready applications:

·      Create configuration interface, so everybody can configure languages, global actions (like language switch, etc.), special characters layout, enable keyboard on a system level, create custom gestures, etc.

·      We need the design for both the Board (colors, fonts) and configuration interface

·      Implement autocorrection (T9) and autosuggestion services. Without these features, nobody will use SwipeBoard instead of a regular software keyboard. This was tested on our friends

·      Create a training guide, to make the moving to the SwipeBoard smooth and comfortable.

·      Improve the algorithm of recognizing swipes, as currently it is a little bit hard to get used to the app in the beginning.

·      We plan to work on eye-disabled people support version of the app as well, but UAT Members (see below) should prioritize this point first.

So, we need at least one iOS and one Android mid-level developer + one Senior QA Engineer. We’ll try to get design without hiring an employee.

Also, we don’t plan to stop on this and we’ll be working on new features described in the video like TV, Smart Watch, Gamepads support.

 

What you get

Everybody who gives us $5+ will get the app for free once it is production ready (for any device type).

Everybody who gives us $100+ will be considered a User Acceptance Testing Member. UAT Members will get the prototype even before it is production ready and receive new features in advance, will have a chance to share their feedback that would be definitely counted, will be able to submit new features they want most (new language integration, two hands input support, etc.) and vote for a particular feature to be prioritized. We are working on implementing web interface for this.

If crowdfunding company fails

If we fail in collecting money, we’ll consider the idea not really interesting for the world and will focus mostly on eye-disabled people app version support as, we believe, it has a social value.

Team Description

Pavel Shabunia – Software Engineer with 11 years of experience. Is handling Tech part.

Tim Sakharchuk – Scrum Master with Software Engineer background (10 years+). Is handling Org part and Development.

Non-financial help

We’ll be glad to accept any non-financial help. For example, if somebody could help with the design for the Board (colors and fonts) and configuration interface that would be very helpful. We’ll prepare requirements at request.

story:
Future on the wrist

Watches that are not only about keeping time turned into a usual part of our everyday environment only recently. However, this innovation especially hit plenty of people pursuing active lifestyles. One of the most populous and rapidly growing communities are cyclists of numerous varieties, like trail riding and mountain biking, road training and regular everyday commuting. People like us and our friends. We ride any terrain, under any conditions, in any weather.


The Problem

In many cases, companies that manufacture smart watches and HRM sport watches rightfully concentrate their effort on developing the core product and pay significantly less attention to the option of easy and secure mounting of the watch on the bicycle handlebar, which a lot of riders would enjoy. As a result, there is either no holder at all or a holder too unhandy for everyday use.


Our Idea

We decided to address the issue by developing the necessary fixture from scratch instead of augmenting the already available designs. We strove for lightweight, simplicity and ease of use, flexibility and integrity, all the while keeping the price affordable and manufacturing eco-friendly.


Path to perfection

After several months of field testing and tweaking, we came up with the multi-purpose design, in which every detail is functionally loaded.  The holder’s base is a precision laser cut strip of  polypropylene – widely available and non-toxic plastic, both affordable and highly durable. The silicone coating of the part that contacts the handlebar prevents skidding in any conditions and the horizontal lock keeps the watch within sight no matter how heavy the jolting. The high-performance hook and loop fastener keeps the holder securely fixed in place.

Our holder is safe for your watch: it does not create any extra load to straps or pins when used according to instructions, mainly because, unlike other holders, it does not require strong tightening and significantly reduces the risk of the watchstrap unbuckling by accident.


One size fits all?

The holder’s dimensions and parameters fit many existent models of sports watches. The holder was developed and tested with Pebble smart watches and with popular wrist-worn HRMs manufactured by Sigma, Garmin and Polar. Its resilient fastening provides the watch with additional protection by absorbing most of the impact energy, and its wide frontal part shields it from water and mud. The holder can be securely attached at any place on the handlebar of the mountain bike or on the bar tape of the road bike – all it takes is the width of two inches! Besides the main, most versatile model, we have also developed variations for compact watches like Sigma PC3 series and tough chronometers like Garmin Fenix. You can make your ride even more advantageous by using apps like Ventoo or Strava and use smart watch to complement your bike computer or completely replace it, as you see fit.


On your arm, bike, desk

And a little special extra! At home, in your office or at the gym, the holder turns into a handy desktop watch stand with an adjustable viewing angle. Are you doing popular plank or squats exercise every day and worried about your heart rate? Place your HRM watch in front of you and enjoy the results!


Why your contribution is important

Currently, we are only manufacturing Smartwatch Anywhere Holders for friends and colleagues who help us with testing so the production cost per item is quite high. With additional funding, we will improve our product and spend the money wisely to satisfy all our contributors without delay:

  • Order a big batch of source polypropylene sheets of the optimal size, density and thickness.
  • Minimize the laser cut bills due to a large manufacturing volume and adjust cut quality for our product.
  • Order custom size hook and loop fasteners for better fixing.
  • Improve the silicone coating durability.
  • Add a bit of nice printing on the holder's surface.
If we secure the necessary funding, we will move forward and offer two-layer models with improved usability in a variety of colors and textures soon after the first wave of manufacturing and shipping to customers!

Risks and challenges

We take our project very seriously: we are confident that we will be able to manufacture and ship our holders on time to all of our contributors. 

We will keep you updated about Smartwatch Anywhere Holders development and your feedback will help us provide you a more sound product.

We understand the simplicity of our idea and probably copies and fakes will appear soon so we did everything possible to protect your investments:

  • Each holder has a unique serial number to prevent counterfeiting.
  • We have applied for a patent in our country.
  • We are serious about legal protection against product copies.


Perks

Classic Holder is a universal one. It fits virtually any watch with a plastic, rubber, resin, leather or similar strap up to one inch (25 mm) in width. When used as a handlebar holder, it safely and reliably keeps any watch in place with weight up to two ounces (50 g) regardless of the size of the watch.

Slim Holder is a lightweight version designed for narrow or small watches with weight up to 40 grams and up to a one-inch wide strap. Ideal as an invisible tabletop stand for your favorite watch.

Tough Holder is a reinforced version created for improved durability in extreme conditions. It is able to carry an up to 90 g watch with a 30-mm wide strap. Virtually indestructible when used as a desktop stand. Casio-style double part metal straps should be used with caution because of their heavy weight.


Project timeline


Our Team

Dmitry

Research and development. A trained engineer. Thousands of miles behind and tens of custom assembled bikes, amateur XC races and first places. Favorite bike: Cannondale Rush 29er, also owns Mongoose fat and Trek road.


Tina

Ideas and inspiration. Financial education. Long distance traveler and crazy about riding in thunderstorm! Favorite bike: Cannondale Jekyll Feminine.


Andrew

Testing and filming. A trained engineer. Everyday commuter and cross-country fan. Everywhere takes his SLR camera. Favorite bike: Univega Alpina.


Product gallery


Thank you so much for your attention - let's make this happen and hope to have you as a our Backer. Please share this campaign with everyone you know.

Smartwatch Anywhere. Striving for Comfort

Smartwatch

story:
Short Summary

Hello everybody. 

My name is Catalin Albastroiu and I'm a 24 year-old finance professional, currently working as a Financial Controller in one of the biggest TV Stations in Romania. Before working here, I accumulated two years of experience as an auditor within one of the Big 4 Companies. 

I have a bachelor's degree and a master's degree in Economics (bachelor's in accounting and master's in financial analysis and company valuation), from a top university from Romania.

I started this campaign in order to access funds for starting a wake-boarding activity. Currently we don't have to much options to practice wake-boarding in Romania and the few companies which allows you to wake-board are practicing high fees. I'm not a professional at this sport, but I would like to have and offer to other the possibility to enjoy their hobbies or, why not, to promote this sport in Romania.

Considering the bureaucracy in Romania, the government or EU grants are really hard, almost impossible, to access, even though the area where I would like to put the basis is not very developed and starting this activity will help the community. Taking in consideration this, making the step from employee to employer is really hard.

What We Need & What You Get

We need around 65,000 USD for setting the basis of the activity. The funds will be used for:

- financing the cable system; 

- fit-out expenses for 5-6 barbecue places (concrete foundation, wooden tables and chairs, wooden roof and, of course, the barbecue) for the people to enjoy while waiting / practicing wake-boarding;

- on-line promotion.

Also, a part of the funds might be used as working capital for the beginning period (until the investments will be finished) and / or the periods of non-favorable weather. 

What do you get? Well, the perks are various, as following:

- boat rides on the lake;

- rides on the cable wake-boarding;

- rides and a barbecue place for a full day;

- one full day for the entire cable wake-boarding and for all barbecue only for you (very suitable for celebrating a day outdoors with your friends).

In the case the goal will not be reached, the project will continue with a bank loan (as hopefully the remaining amount will be lower and the bank will be able to grant the loan) and the perks will still be granted :)

The Impact

As briefly mentioned above, setting the wake-boarding activity will help develop the community where it will be based by creating jobs and increasing the consumption in the area (from the people using the wake-boarding and the barbecue places).

Moreover, it will help us preserve the natural lake on which the cable system will be installed, preventing from other type of activities to be conducted over there (like poaching, pollution, drying it out, abandoning it). Being Eco-friendly, the Eco-system will be able to survive in it's natural habitat.

Risks & Challenges

We haven't identified any significant risks nor challenges which we might face while trying the achieve our goal. 

The main risk would be not raising sufficient funds to start the activity. In this case, after the campaign ends, if the Romanian State will restart the program for the start-ups, we will also apply for it in order to access additional funds.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even a share might help the campaign, so please do not hesitate to spread the word around :).

Thank you very much and hopefully we'll meet at a wake-board ride,

Catalin

Currently we don't have to much options to practice wake-boarding in Romania and the few companies which allows you to wake-board are practicing high fees. I'm not a professional at this sport, but I would like to have and offer to other the possibility to enjoy their hobbies or, why not, to promote this sport in Romania.
Considering the bureaucracy in Romania, the government or EU grants are really hard, almost impossible, to access, even though the area where I would like to put the basis is not very developed and starting this activity will help the community. Taking in consideration this, making the step from employee to employer is really hard.   What We Need & What You Get We need around 65,000 USD for setting the basis of the activity. The funds will be used for:
- financing the cable system; 
- fit-out expenses for 5-6 barbecue places (concrete foundation, wooden tables and chairs, wooden roof and, of course, the barbecue) for the people to enjoy while waiting / practicing wake-boarding;
- on-line promotion.
Also, a part of the funds might be used as working capital for the beginning period (until the investments will be finished) and / or the periods of non-favorable weather. 
What do you get? Well, the perks are various, as following:
- boat rides on the lake;
- rides on the cable wake-boarding;
- rides and a barbecue place for a full day;
- one full day for the entire cable wake-boarding and for all barbecue only for you (very suitable for celebrating a day outdoors with your friends).
In the case the goal will not be reached, the project will continue with a bank loan (as hopefully the remaining amount will be lower and the bank will be able to grant the loan) and the perks will still be granted :)   The Impact As briefly mentioned above, setting the wake-boarding activity will help develop the community where it will be based by creating jobs and increasing the consumption in the area (from the people using the wake-boarding and the barbecue places).
Moreover, it will help us preserve the natural lake on which the cable system will be installed, preventing from other type of activities to be conducted over there (like poaching, pollution, drying it out, abandoning it). Being Eco-friendly, the Eco-system will be able to survive in it's natural habitat.
    Risks & Challenges We haven't identified any significant risks nor challenges which we might face while trying the achieve our goal. 
The main risk would be not raising sufficient funds to start the activity. In this case, after the campaign ends, if the Romanian State will restart the program for the start-ups, we will also apply for it in order to access additional funds.
    Other Ways You Can Help Even a share might help the campaign, so please do not hesitate to spread the word around :).
Thank you very much and hopefully we'll meet at a wake-board ride,
Catalin

story:
Video Review:

Kodiola is Easier than other Kodi Boxes

Just plug in the device, connect it to a TV, and you are ready to start using Kodi like always! No installing APKs or signing up for Amazon subscriptions required.

Automatic Updates

           

Kodiola will automatically update Kodi and the Linux OS it runs on so you always have the latest and most secure software running, without having to manually update every few months.

Sync Configuration and Media Collection

Kodiola boxes sync configurations with each other, so once you configure your settings and repos, it is synced across all the Kodiola boxes and TVs in your home. One box functions as the "guru" which pushes settings to the other "follower" boxes.

Once devices are connected together, unify the media on all Kodiola devices and access your complete aggregated library from all of the other Kodiola boxes in your home!

 

Kodiola is Smarter than other Kodi Boxes

In addition to the features that make Kodiola easier to use, there are smart features in Kodiola that help you get the most out of this next generation Kodi box.

Personal Cloud/NAS

Use the personal cloud features to stream and share your content from anywhere, whether it is your imported media collection or DVR content from Kodi streams. Kodiola supports web browsers and mobile apps.

Use internal or external USB storage:

To access content remotely, just type in the URL (or use the Kodiola mobile app):

Login:

Browse your content:

Stream your content:

Or share your content with others, using a simple URL for them to start streaming just by putting it into their browser:

 

Mobile App with Integrated Remote (Kore)

 

Kodiola is Faster than Other Kodi Boxes

Powered by an Intel CPU and running on a minimal footprint install of Linux, Kodiola runs Kodi fast enough for high definition videos without the wait times after clicking on menus.

Specs:

  • Intel Atom Baytrail Z3735F (Quad Core, 1.33GHz, up to 1.93GHz)
  • 2GB DDR3L RAM, 1333MHz
  • 16GB of eMMC internal storage
  • 100 Mbps LAN
  • 3x USB 2.0 ports
  • Kodiola Custom Fedora Remix Linux Distribution (minimal packages for maximum performance)
  • Size & Weight: 32x43x26cm; 450g

 

We need you!

We have made a fully functional prototype with completed software as pictured, and even sent out a few units for feedback (see above for video review by Peter "Repo Man" Carcione!)

A manufacturer is lined up and all we need are enough backers to help us satisfy the MOQ (minimum order quantity) required to place the initial order.

 

The perfect holiday gift!

If you select the early bird perk, you get an exclusive discount ($129). This discount is only available for Indiegogo backers who back us before the end of the year!

Please note: shipping costs are automatically calculated based on your country. We may update those after the campaign ends to reflect actual shipping prices.

story:
More Than Just a Pretty Case

Wireless Charging and so much more...

The CLIKI Smart Mod uses the latest Qi wireless charging technology that is compatible with most wireless charging bases available on the market today.  Simply place the phone on the charging base to charge.  No more fuss with USB cables or fumbling to locate the charging port on your phone.

Control Your World

You can control thousands of smart home devices connected to Google Home including TVs, lights, switches, plugs, thermostats, and more using your Cliki Smart Mod.  Start Netflix, dim your lights or set your alarm.  Just click the button on the CLIKI Smart Mod to activate Google Assistant and control your world. 

Safety In A Heartbeat

Your personal PANIC button.  Get the help you need, when you need it.  Life can take an unexpected turn in an instant.  Having a lifeline that you can quickly access could save your life.   Just click 3 times regardless of the mode setting or long press in SOS mode to send an alert text with your GPS location to emergency contacts you select.  It will also activate a tracking beacon so they can find you wherever you go.

 

Easy Button

Having a physical button allows you to choose what is most important to you. It is easily configurable with the simple to use CLIKI Mod App.  The big button makes blind operation of your phone so much easier.  Calling a pre-programmed number or selecting your favorite song in your playlist is performed with just a click, all without having to remove your gloves or take the phone from your pocket.  This is great for those who are visually impaired or when engaged in activities where it is difficult to get to your phone such as when skiing, biking or running. 

 

How It Works

 

Simple To Use

Using the CLIKI Smart Mod is simple.  You can have the button do only one function or many.  First open the CLIKI App and select one of the pre-programmed  functions from the rotary dial.  The functions are grouped in sets and will display the clicks required in the information bar at the bottom of the page.  Simply click the button on the smart mod to activate the features for that function.  For example, if Music Mode is selected in the CLIKI Mod App, simply click the button once to toggle between Play and Pause, or click twice to skip to the next song on your playlist.  That's it!  No need for confusing programming steps or lengthy set-up.  The CLIKI Smart Mod does it all for you.   

 

Easy To Customize

For those that need more customization, simply select the My Click function from the main dial wheel.  With My Click you can program your own function for each click by selecting from any of the pre-programmed features, launch any App on your phone, or select from available Tasks such as call a cab, order Pizza etc.

My Click comes pre-programmed with the following click defaults:

1-Click to Play/Pause Music

2-Click to skip to the next song

3-Click to activate SOS

Long Press to activate Google Assistant

 

 

What We Need

We NEED your help to complete development of the CLIKI smart mod and to get to production.   Early working prototypes are completed but we need funds for tooling, pilot builds and production inventory.  Here are ways you can help us meet our goal:

 

About Us

Our team consists of seasoned engineers that previously worked at top tech companies.  We  decided to run our own tech startup led by our CEO Wayne Phang, a former Motorola Engineer and US Air Force veteran.  Combined we have developed and launched over 100 consumer and enterprise technology products to market.

We are a small startup located in Pompano Beach Florida.  Last year we were selected as one of the finalist of the "Transform the smartphone challenge" and were invited to travel to Chicago to make our pitch to the Motorola, Verizon and Lenovo executives.

Even though our CLIKI PLAY game controller mod was voted #1 of the "Top 5 New Cool Moto Z Mods" and made the list of top "Awesome Inventions of 2017", we unfortunately did not win the grand prize.  As it turned out, Motorola already had a game controller in the works (Oh well...).  We did however had an awesome time touring the Motorola headquarters and meeting all the finalists from the the contest (some really great teams out there!).  

In the end, we did not leave empty handed, as the Moto mods team were so impressed with our work that they invited us to join their accelerator program where they helped us to develop our CLIKI Smart Mod idea.  The CLIKI smart mod is based on our CLIKI Wireless Smart Button product available on Amazon or our website http://clikibutton.com and was featured in CNET, Yahoo, WIRED and more.  

Motorola's Mod platform allow us to integrate the button directly with the phone hardware giving us a more reliable connection, faster response and direct HID control of phone functions.  Access to the phone power control pins provide improved power management capability for rapid charging and battery maintenance.

 

Risks & Challenges

Based on our experience developing and launching many technology products to market, we do not anticipate any red flags.  However, this does not mean there won't be any.  Our experience also tells us to expect the unexpected.   Even though we have already vetted the design and manufacturing process with the Mods team, our main concern would be with complying with  Motorola's product certification requirements.  Knowing what it takes from a prior insider's view to Motorola's certification process, I can tell you (and all the the other mod developer teams) that it is not simple and things can easily hit a snag.  However,  we are confident that there will be nothing we have not faced and overcome before.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Click the "share" icon at the top of the campaign page to let your friends know about the CLIKI Smart Mod.

The more people show interest in our campaign the better we rank in the competition so help us to get CLIKI Mod to market!

story:
Let me tell you a story how I managed to rescue some wood planks and handcraft an awesome product with global impact.

 

We live in an era where days seems like hours, and hours pass like minutes. We live in the World where environment is taken for granted, where woods are just some large pile of plants that produce oxygen and looks nice. People are less considerate about the Earth than never before. 

We want to change that! 

Introducing iPallet4.me - a tablet cover made from used transport pallets.

 

Personal story: when I bought my first tablet, I didn't want to buy some rubber/plastic case for it. Eventually I did, but only to protect the device from scratching. Since I was in pallet crafting as a hobby woodworker, I thought: "It will be cool to produce wooden case from pallet wood".

At first, I thought It can't be done.

 

 But wait, there's more! 

 

 

 

Others about us

 

 

 

Featured in: 1001pallets - Recycled Pallet Tablet Case

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Why only these types of tablets? Thanks for asking. 

There are  tremendous types of tablets out there on the market.  We are producing only for the best selling models according to our research and intuition. 

With the development of a single case for a single tablet requiring a large quantity of our limited resources, the necessity to be strategically selective is paramount. 

Scratch protection with soft, eco friendly leather.

 

Choose your finish : natural, burned, black. We'll get in touch after you became "the backer". 

 

 

Your logo engraved? No problem.

 

Handcrafted juta bags for shipping.

 

 

 

 

Side Perks

Pallet coasters

Every piece of wood is valuable. Therefore, nothing is left unused. Pallet coaster are made from the rest of the wood during production process.

 

T-Shirt 

Who doesn't like T-shirts? 

 

 

About the project

This is a pallet, okay? Lots of dirty, old, pallets. Used pallets are usually thrown away like that. 

 

And this is a tablet.

Nice, isn't it.

 

The process

 

1. Sketching

 

 

2. Rendering

 

3. Preparing the pallet wood

 

4. Preparing the panels for CNC milling

 

5. Assembling 

 

 

6. And it's done. Well, 99% of it. 

There is always room for improvment.

 
 

Who am I?

 

 

Terms & Conditions

 

We put few years into our product and we believe in it, we believe in ourselves and we cherish our backers and supporters opinion.

Final assembling will pass 4 check points from four different people that will mix all 4 checkpoints per person. That means every inhouse inspector will check all these four highlights combined. The check points are:

1. Finishing

2. Gluing

3. Tablet compatibility

4. Final touch.

If you are not satisfied with the product, kindly send us an email with reasons why is that. Don't make any noise, don't shout, don't scream - just say what is the problem and we'll try to fix it. If you are not happy with the product, please send us back and we'll figure what to do next. 

Our warranty for cases doesn't extend to be damaged from abuse (do, you can not jump on it), moisture (no, it is not waterproof), extreme temperatures (no, you can not bake a barbecue on it), or unexpected impact (no, you can not play frisbee with it) (even though it flies really well).

 

Delivery time

If the campaign blows away like it should, we will have a busy summer collecting the pallets, dismantling them and push through the production process. Every piece will go through our hands several times before it will be packed into our Juta bags and shipped.  

You will have your case ready and shipped right before you even start your Christmas shopping plan.  Dead line is November 2017 but we'll try to ship it as early as possible. 

 

And remember: this is a pallet wood, not first class material.

story:
About Me:

I am a University Of Houston student trying to finish my degree in sports administration. I am the oldest of three with 2 brothers. I love to fish, play video games, and watch anime. 

What is the Money for?!

I researched what I need to do, but the only thing I don't have is the funds! 5,000 is a lot of money. I don't expect to get all of it! But Every Amount Counts! All of the money will go towards the developing of this app. Making sure it is made, formatted, tested, debugged etc. If I go beyond my goal, I will use the rest of the money for marketing. Making sure that everyone hears about this great idea! 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge from the start is to get the word out. The app only goes as far as the people make it. The more people download the more money can be given out!

The second biggest challenge is convincing people this is real. "The app is free and I never have to spend money to win money?" Sounds too good to be true. But it is! Honestly, if it keeps people off their phones and makes lives safer than it is definitely worth the investment!

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!!

  • Ask people to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
  • Please Share!
