story:
INTRODUCING JUICEON


The World's First Attachable Wireless Power Bank 
The Most Effortless Phone Charging Solution  

Simply stick and go to boost your phone for 50% more battery.

 

JuiceOn is an extremely mobile power bank that can be used in all of those emergency situations. Unlike wall sockets or other portable chargers, JuiceOn simplifies the entire charging process by making charging more accessible and convenient.

 

A set of JuiceOn (4pcs) can charge iPhoneX to full twice with a charging speed of 80% charge per hour. One piece of JuiceOn can power up your phone 50% more battery.

 

 

We Shouldn’t Sacrifice Convenience For Capacity. 


In fact, we don't actually charge our power bank to full every day. Because we spend most of our day indoor with power accessed. The frequency of using a big power bank in a week is not quite often. 

We believe eschews any kind of feature or element that is seen as a distraction, or a complication to a basic design can make things easier and better.

 

Carrying extra weight for the unneeded battery is seen as a distraction for the people who wants to pack light.  

 

 


 

By allowing you to get rid of your bulky power bank, JuiceOn encourages you to pack light to minimize your carry-on weights when you going out.

  

We believed in this kind of design philosophy and it is something that we not only applied to all our dedication of product creation but our life as well.

 

Be Hassle-Free When Charging

 

We completely reimagined how phones should get charged in the easiest way. JuiceOn combines advanced self-engineered gel technology and Qi wireless charging technology to offer you the most convenient charging experience. 

 

 

JuiceOn Benefits Your Everyday Life!

 

Because JuiceOn is...

 


 

 

 

 

Charge while listening music?  Pack light for your workout? No Problem!

 

Need to charge your phone while playing your favorite game? No Problem!

It enhances accessibility to your phone while it's charging.

 


 

JuiceOn Makes Sharing Easier

Because Life is About Caring & Sharing

 

JuiceOn is capable to power up multiple devices simultaneously according to your needs.

 

 

Group Charging Station

JuiceOn offers a set of charging station for the pledge of 4 pads or more.

 

The charging station can charge 4 pads simultaneously.

A set of JuiceOn (4pcs) can charge iPhoneX to full twice.

 

Stay Neat & Stay Elegant!

 

 

How Does JuiceOn Charge Wirelessly

 

JuiceOn's improved transmitter coil in the charging base generates a wider electromagnetic field that able to deliver electrons through a thicker barrier then powering the battery.

For our charging packs, we use high-capacity lithium batteries with lithium cobalt oxide cathodes alongside a high-quality chipset and coil module. This provides an 85% boost to conversion efficiency. 

 

A set of JuiceOn (4pcs) can charge iPhoneX to full twice with a charging speed of 80% charge per hour. One piece of JuiceOn can power up your phone 50% more battery.


 

 

Other Goodness

  • No hassle charging through the bulkiest phone case.
  • Advanced Nanotechnology Adhesive Layer
  • Works With Any Phone
  • Reusable
    • The sticky side of the battery pack is designed to be reusable. You can always wash it when it gets dusty, then drying up and it can be reused again and still stays sticky.
  • Won't Make a Mess

  •  

 

Secured & Durable

  • Won't Scratch
  • Low Temperature
  • Interference-Free
  • Intelligent Reliable Protection System
  • Overcurrent, Overvoltage, Short Circuit, and Overheated Protection.
  • Foreign Object Detection -- (FOD) is a safety mechanism which automatically interrupts power delivery if there is interference caused by a foreign object.

 

 


 

 

 

Press Kit

If you're a member of the press looking for info or media assets, please download our Media & Press kit here, or contact us at hi@juiceon.cc

 


JuiceOn is a team composed of structural designers and electronic engineers. Our philosophy is to build the best quality product. Any detail of the product reflects our care to the customers. We always maintain a very stringent quality standard no matter in product design, development process, or even the choice of accessories procurement, so we can develop a truly valuable item.

 

Why JuiceOn

A lot of people will tell you that while it’s nice to have some extra juice staying outdoor, the hassle of having to hold the bulky power bank can detract from your enjoyment of those very activities. You could keep the 'brick' in your pocket, but not everyone wishes to be such inconvenient. That's the reason we created JuiceOn. 

 


 

 

Path We've Went Through

 

From the early stage concept to today's prototype, we have redesigned the structure many times until we found the best alternative. 

From stacking style to vertical standing charging style

from a set of three pads to a set of four pads

We've been continuously improving the design to achieve the better user experience

story:
How it all started

Hello there!

We are Rasim, Teymur, and Tural - co-founders of Raters. 

As many of you, we love watching great movies, discovering new actors and directors, and, most importantly, sharing all of this with friends who share a similar passion for cinema. 

However, every attempt to watch something new would be accompanied by questions such as "What should we watch?", "What was the movie Emily was talking about?", "What would Pedro say about this film?" and so on...

...and, yes, this would take hours. 

To solve this issue for ourselves and for all the movie enthusiasts out there, we decided to create an app that would allow users to connect with people whose taste they trust and have their movie reviews and Watchlists all in one place. In other words - to create Raters.   

 

Didn't you guys just reinvent the wheel?

With so many movie platforms like IMDB, Rotten Tomatoes, and Netflix, why do we need another one? The answer is simple - your friends. If you think about it, quite frequently good movie recommendations emerge from your conversations with friends and acquaintances.

The key difference between Raters and conventional movie platforms is its focus on the social aspect and interaction between movie enthusiasts. Raters allows you to see what movies your friends have watched recently, how they rated them and what they thought about them. Besides, you can like and comment on their reviews, facilitating further discussion, which may lead you to your new favourite movie.

Raters:

Why do we exist?

We have an ambitious aim to help develop the film industry, and our goals can be categorised into two broad areas:

1. For users, we seek to create a global community of movie lovers where they can share their experiences and find movies that they will enjoy.

2. For independent studios and directors, we seek to create a platform where they can find their relevant audiences, who are most likely to be interested in their films.
 

Why this campaign is so important for us

It has been a long and rocky (but also a super-fun) road from the day the idea was conceived. 

Today we have a fully working version of our app on the App Store (and we would love to hear your feedback!)

What we also have is an avalanche of ideas we would like to test and implement to enhance user experience. Your support would allow us to realize our ambitions and to fulfill our vision of creating a global community of movie enthusiasts! 

Campaign Goal

In short, we plan to target our efforts and funding on developing app functionality and adding new features. Based on existing users' feedback, these will include:

1. Trailers
Watch trailers of new releases without leaving the app


2. Actors and Directors Navigation
Search for trending actors or films by your favourite directors


3. Extension to Android
Download Raters on Google Play and start following friends who use Android
(We are also keen to release a Web version if we exceed our target!)


4. Groundbreaking Recommendation System (!)

OK, hear us out here, because we really want you to understand what makes our recommendation system ground-breaking.

Imagine you are trying to get a recommendation from some conventional platform. In most, if not all, cases the result will be based on your previous ratings.

With Raters, you will receive suggestions based  on movies you rated, your preferred genres, actors, and directors, as well as tailored recommendations based on who you follow, whose posts you like and comment on, and even how closely your movie taste correlates.

Add those factors together, and your next perfect movie is only a couple clicks away.

We are still working on how this system will be implemented within the app. The way our team envisions it at the moment is a completely new screen (such as the draft design below), in which you can access movie recommendations individually tailored to you. This is still a work-in-progress but it will be perfected each time someone rates a movie.


 

Stretch Goals

While user experience remains the most important part of our project, we are also involved with filmmakers, studios and other stakeholders within the film industry.

Therefore, we introduced the so-called "Stretch Goal" - additional milestones we set out in the event we exceed our funding target.

  1. Engage British Film Institute (BFI) in our project. Collaboration with BFI will allow us to support BFI’s aim "to champion diverse, bold and distinctive films and increase the audiences for them". It is perfectly aligned to what we are hoping achieve at Raters.
     
  2. Cooperating with independent studios and directors with the aim of promoting their productions and supporting young talent. Our engagement with directors to date confirmed that they would be interested in Raters to help promote their films to their relevant audience and would thus would greatly optimise their Paper and Advertising (P&A) costs, especially in non-mainstream genres, such art-house, sci-fi and documentaries.

Our projections suggest that once we hit our target cash raised, we will be able to get started on all of the above. So if you're excited about Raters, all you need to do is - back us, buckle up, and join us for the ride! 

 

What does it look like inside Raters?

The best way to find it out is to download Raters from the App Store (an Android version is in the works!) and explore it on your own. But for the lazy ones out there - have a look at the Raters App Demonstration video below:



Awesome! ...and what do I get?

Our love and eternal gratitude...what else does one need besides these two?

Just kidding…we have prepared plenty of cool items for our backers that we are sure you'll be delighted with! We'll also make sure that you get them by Xmas, so these perks will be a nice gift to your movie-loving friends.


 

Your Premium Account will have a star next to your profile, making you stand out from other users. Your reviews will be shown on top of each page, and you will be recommended to other users as an avid rater. All that’s needed from you is to keep watching movies and producing quality reviews!

Who Are We?

Our team consists of us (the founders), and dozens of our friends and relatives, who have been supporting us with our project. And it makes sense, because Raters, just as life itself, is all about family and friends. Here is our core team:

Love Raters but low on budget? You can still help

Don't worry, we still like you. But if you get the word out and make some noise about our campaign we will like you even more! :)

A wide coverage is a cornerstone of a successful campaign, so your "share" may be the one that does it for us!
story_txt:
How it all started
Hello there!
We are Rasim, Teymur, and Tural - co-founders of Raters. 
As many of you, we love watching great movies, discovering new actors and directors, and, most importantly, sharing all of this with friends who share a similar passion for cinema. 
However, every attempt to watch something new would be accompanied by questions such as "What should we watch?", "What was the movie Emily was talking about?", "What would Pedro say about this film?" and so on...
...and, yes, this would take hours. 
To solve this issue for ourselves and for all the movie enthusiasts out there, we decided to create an app that would allow users to connect with people whose taste they trust and have their movie reviews and Watchlists all in one place. In other words - to create Raters.   

 
Didn't you guys just reinvent the wheel?
With so many movie platforms like IMDB, Rotten Tomatoes, and Netflix, why do we need another one? The answer is simple - your friends. If you think about it, quite frequently good movie recommendations emerge from your conversations with friends and acquaintances.
The key difference between Raters and conventional movie platforms is its focus on the social aspect and interaction between movie enthusiasts. Raters allows you to see what movies your friends have watched recently, how they rated them and what they thought about them. Besides, you can like and comment on their reviews, facilitating further discussion, which may lead you to your new favourite movie.

story:
The inventor of the MyGrams scale, Daniel Blumer, had to see the struggles diabetes posed every day because of a relative with diabetes type 1. It was apparent to him how hard it could be, to constantly be careful not to take too many carbs, or perhaps too little. Being a witness of all that hardship, Daniel eventually decided to initiate work toward helping this dear family member of his. Soon he realized that by helping his family, he could actually aid many other people suffering from the same disease worldwide.

You are able to choose from four different models, depending on the size and capacity.
The size options can be seen in the picture below.

MyGrams Scale is the model which is attachable to the phone case via the bumper. MyGrams MINI is just a little bit bigger than a business card and will not be mounted on the back of your phone.

There are two capacities available for each model. 

  • 2 kg (4.4 pounds) loading capacity with 1-gram resolution
  • 50 gram (1.7637 ounces) loading capacity with 0.01-gram resolution

Hello world of applications!

We've shown our scale and app to a lot of people. And we know that we've created an app which has a lot to offer. But we've heard a lot of cool ideas outside of the nutrition spectrum, be it a Cocktail Mixer, a Drinking Game, or Barista Tool. And not only that, some folk would like to integrate the data we provide into the app they already use on a daily base - i.e. Fitness Trackers and other Health Apps. 

But since our resources are limited, and we know that our smart scale is just as smart as the apps which are built for it, we decided to open up our scale! We will make it possible for new and established developers to integrate the MyGrams Scale into their app. We are already in contact with some apps with 100k+ downloads, which are interested. It is our vision, that one day, renowned software apps like Myfitnesspal or Apple Health App will join us and make use of the weight in applications.    

 

The team is based in Vienna, Austria and combines know-how from engineering, manufacturing, IT, medicine and fitness. 

Daniel Blumer -  Engineer

Alexander Dimitrov - Designer

Philipp Omenitsch - Coder

Kevin Benckendorf - Marketing

Philip Dimitrov - Operations

 

 

MyGrams 2Minuten2Millionen pictures are (c) Gerry Frank.

story:
When it comes to 3D printing, one of the biggest questions was: cheap, or fast? Most sub $300 3D printers are slow. They can print at around 30mm/s, maximum. That's not a big problem, as long as you don't want to print something over a few cubic centimetres. But if you want? Better get ready to grow grey hair.

Of course, you can go for a multiple thousands of dollars machine, which will work fast, a precise. There are also DIY kits, for around $2-300, which can deliver a decent performance. But do you really want to tweak, calibrate, assemble, upgrade, and fine-tune your printer for hours, and then re-calibrate between every print?

That's why we created AVOC.

AVOC is compact


While AVOC boasts an over 3L (183 cubic inches) build volume, it only measures 222*222*355mm, which means small footprint. The whole printer weights less than 3kg (6.61 lbs), making AVOC a real desktop 3D printer.


AVOC is fast



While It's more than three times faster than the other similarly priced desktop 3D printers. And it could be even faster, but since it's lightweight, we limited the maximal printing speed to 100mm/s, to avoid resonance.


Enclosed build chamber



AVOC features a completely enclosed build chamber. Not only does this keep the super hot nozzle away from children, pets, and flammable material, but it also helps to reduce the filaments smell, and it improves build quality drastically. It also helps to avoid breaking the print from a sudden air temperature change.


AVOC is safe



Not only do we use a completely enclosed build chamber, we also use low voltage components, and a full RGB LED feedback to indicate the hotend temperature.


AVOC is CoreXY



AVOC is a real CoreXY, not a H-bot. What does this mean? The effector is lightweight, and the horizontal motors don't move. This means, that each motor has to carry less than 100gramms, and most of the time they work in unison. CoreXY based builds are balanced, fast, and unlike H-bots they don't tend to bend. We found a way to eliminate the belt crossing, while minimising loads on the Y bearings.


AVOC is simple


We found, that the main reason why 3D printers are expensive is the complexity, and the high number of parts used. Not only does this mean a bigger part cost, but it also increases labour time, and makes QC much harder. With AVOC, we tried to reduce part count as much as possible. For example: we incorporated the Z axis bearing housing, the electronics housing, the filament holder, and the extruder housing in one part. This only reduced the assembly time by over 30 minutes per printer.

Non-propietary filament



AVOC uses non propietary, 1.75mm diameter filament. It's filament compartment can store one standard 1kg roll, up to 200mm diameter. This allows you to keep using the filament you like, or buy filament at the local 3D printer store!


"QC passed" is NOT a sticker.

And this goes for both electronics, the power supply, hotend, and mechanical parts. User experience depends greatly on the number of problems one experiences with a product, and our aim for this number is 0. For this, we developed a fast, and reliable method for checking if all manufactured AVOCs meet our quality requirements.


We talked about what AVOC is... But how did we achieve this?

First a little bit about how the production costs usually build up. Let's take a generic, $500 Cartesian 3D printer as an example. These use a ramps board, with a4988 stepper drivers, and nema 17 motors. Usually with a knock off hotend. Let's assume it has a frame assembled out of aluminium extrusions. Usually it takes 4 hours to assemble one of these printers. The cost breakdown will be something like this:

As you can see, the most expensive parts are the frame, the electronics, the steppers, and the assembly.

So we started reducing the costs:

Mechanics:


We use cheaper steppers where high torque and high speed is not necessary. The CoreXY allows us to use less expensive NEMA17 steppers on the X-Y axes, becouse they stay in place, so both the X, and Y carriage are lightweight. The two carriages together weigh less than 100 gramms.

Frame:

Our printer uses a polycarbonate frame, which costs an extremely low amount of money. We can't post a picture of that, as we want to keep the exact how to a secret. Let's just say it's not the trivial solution.

Custom parts:

AVOC has almost all parts custom made. The only exceptions are the bearings, linear rails, motors, and the timing belts (yeah, the fasteners too). This allowed us to reduce the part count to an incredibly low number. Just the above mentioned filament compartment reduced the part count by 4. Our main mechanics are similar to this. We use a single piece for the X-Y (A-B) motors, the Z bearings, and the idlers.

Commercial grade parts:

 We could manufacture parts with extremely high precision, but that would cost a fortune. Instead, we decided to use commercial tolerances, which would lead to lower quality.... but they won't. Why? Because we designed AVOC with our mind full of tolerance calculations. This led us to a design, which actually eliminates all play where it would impact print quality. This means, that the cover of the filament tray might have a little play, or the fan can be positioned 0.4mm off, as it won't cause failed prints, but the bearings have no play. And they won't wear fast, don't worry about that.

Heated bed, and hotend:



We don't have a heated bed. Now you might ask: but why did you place that roll of ABS inside the printer in the video? Doesn't that require heated bed to stick? The answer is no, it doesn't. ABS sticks well to our bed material, and it's a commercially available plastic. So if anything would happen to your printbed, you can replace it easily.

Our hotend is a custom one. This is the only part not cheaper than most j-head knock-offs. It's actually more expensive. Now you might say "whoa, but why would you do that?". The answer is weight. We spare more on the weight reduction, than the hotend costs. And it's necessary for our high performance. We need active cooling, but with these small dimensions we need a really good heat distribution too to achieve the high printing speed.

Electronics:

We have it custom made. A multiple board solution wouldn't be reliable enough, and most boards have too much features we wouldn't use, but still have to pay for. For example: we don't need 6 endstop connectors, or heatbed temperature sensor. This is a great reduction in cost, and high reliability improvement.

Last, but not least, the assembly costs:

Our printer will be assembled inside the EU. This would usually mean high manufacturing costs, but we designed AVOC for manufacturing. Our colleagues building the printers won't have to solder wires standing on their head manipulating through a half inch hole. Let's just say AVOC is probably the fastest to assemble 3D printer.

Specifications


                   



Pledge levels




Schedule


                           



Our team


We are a young team of 3D printing enthusiast. We share a passion about 3D printing, and creating.

Our team includes specialists in the field of marketing, mechanical engineering, mechatronics, and programming. We worked together on a few projects before, so we know each others strengths, and weaknesses. Now we combined our knowledge to create AVOC, the super cheap, and super fast 3D printer.

We also have many advisers behind the scenes, who help us with realising our goals.



Risks & Challenges


AVOC is a hardware, and hardware is hard. Until now, we only had a prototype printer, which is built by using different manufacturing methods than those intended to be used in the final version. The mass production units will use mould injected, extruded, and other mass manufactured parts, instead of the 3D printed ones we used in our prototype. This means, that they will have different properties, and they will need minor changes in order to deliver the high performance expected of them.

Manufacturing/lead times:

We know, that the parts of AVOC are manufacturable, and we have quotations for tooling, and manufacturing, and parts, but we also know, that getting them right takes time. And making changes takes even more time.

Sourcing :

There is also a risk with sourcing. We designed AVOC with parts available from a wide range of suppliers, so all parts are always available in large quantities, however they have to be shipped to us so we can assemble them. And while shipping usually takes less than 60 days, there can always be delays.

Money management:

We have seen crowdfunding campaigns go south because of overspending. We left a safety margin for us, and we minimized the expenses.

All summed up:

We checked out, and analysed all mayor crowdfunding campaigns which run into problems. We are confident we will not make the same mistakes, and we can make AVOC happen. We set our delivery date to December, as we wanted to keep at least two months reserve, and we are confident to deliver by then. The same goes for our $200 000 campaign goal. Sure, $100 000 would look better, but then there wouldn't be any reserve should anything happen. We will also keep our spendings as open as possible, and keep you informed!


THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP

We got this far on our own, but we can't proceed without standing on the shoulders of giants.

Now we need You to help us get AVOC to off the ground!


Q&A

Why is the AVOC special? Why should I buy it?

First of all AVOC is cheap. On Indiegogo you can get it for 139$, but for this price you get the fastest 3D printer from its price range. Moreover the building volume is more than 3 litre. In addition you get a brand new and unique interface, which is easy to use.

How is this speed possible?
We know that you don't want to wait hours for the printed piece, so to reach this speed AVOC uses the right motors for the job. It also has many other advanced solutions to speed up the process.

Why is it so cheap?
We don't use unnecessary things in the AVOC, just essential things and materials to make a safe, fast, and reliable printer.

When will I get the product?
According to our plans the AVOC will be shipped at the end of the year, so you can put your AVOC under the Christmas tree.

You mentioned the new interface. What is it about?
Our programmers are working on a brand new interface for everybody. This means that it will be simple, so beginners can use it too, but it will have the possibility for the advanced users to change the settings.

Does the AVOC need anything special in the house or on the computer?
No you just need a socket and a computer and the spirit to print something.

I am not an expert in assembling. Do I have to do anything special with the AVOC when it arrives?
No it is plug and play. Just plug it into an electric outlet, do a basic set-up and and it is ready to use.

What kind of material does AVOC use to print?
AVOC can use almost every common printing materials which is non-flexible. It is pretty easy to get these materials from the internet or 3D printing shops.

Is AVOC safe?
Yes. It has a completely enclosed build area, so it’s safe for operation. (We tested it in cats, they couldn’t get inside.) In addition AVOC using low voltage components, and full RGB LEDs are indicating if the nozzle is hot.

What source file can AVOC use?

The printer accepts standard g-code, like any other printers. The GUI accepts.stl files.

How much does shipping cost?

It depends on where you live. We are still negotiating with shipping companies, so we will try to ship for the lowest possible price.

How much does VAT, and duty cost?

Most of the time 3D printers are duty free (at least in the EU). The recipient is responsible to pay VAT, and duty, if applies.

We don't have a heated bed. Now you might ask: but why did you place that roll of ABS inside the printer in the video? Doesn't that require heated bed to stick? The answer is no, it doesn't. ABS sticks well to our bed material, and it's a commercially available plastic. So if anything would happen to your printbed, you can replace it easily. 
Our hotend is a custom one. This is the only part not cheaper than most j-head knock-offs. It's actually more expensive. Now you might say "whoa, but why would you do that?". The answer is weight. We spare more on the weight reduction, than the hotend costs. And it's necessary for our high performance. We need active cooling, but with these small dimensions we need a really good heat distribution too to achieve the high printing speed.
Electronics:
We have it custom made. A multiple board solution wouldn't be reliable enough, and most boards have too much features we wouldn't use, but still have to pay for. For example: we don't need 6 endstop connectors, or heatbed temperature sensor. This is a great reduction in cost, and high reliability improvement.
Last, but not least, the assembly costs:
Our printer will be assembled inside the EU. This would usually mean high manufacturing costs, but we designed AVOC for manufacturing. Our colleagues building the printers won't have to solder wires standing on their head manipulating through a half inch hole. Let's just say AVOC is probably the fastest to assemble 3D printer.
Specifications




                    


Pledge levels




Schedule



                            


Our team


We are a young team of 3D printing enthusiast. We share a passion about 3D printing, and creating.
Our team includes specialists in the field of marketing, mechanical engineering, mechatronics, and programming. We worked together on a few projects before, so we know each others strengths, and weaknesses. Now we combined our knowledge to create AVOC, the super cheap, and super fast 3D printer.
We also have many advisers behind the scenes, who help us with realising our goals. 
Risks & Challenges

AVOC is a hardware, and hardware is hard. Until now, we only had a prototype printer, which is built by using different manufacturing methods than those intended to be used in the final version. The mass production units will use mould injected, extruded, and other mass manufactured parts, instead of the 3D printed ones we used in our prototype. This means, that they will have different properties, and they will need minor changes in order to deliver the high performance expected of them.
Manufacturing/lead times: 

We know, that the parts of AVOC are manufacturable, and we have quotations for tooling, and manufacturing, and parts, but we also know, that getting them right takes time. And making changes takes even more time. 
Sourcing :
 There is also a risk with sourcing. We designed AVOC with parts available from a wide range of suppliers, so all parts are always available in large quantities, however they have to be shipped to us so we can assemble them. And while shipping usually takes less than 60 days, there can always be delays. 
Money management: 

We have seen crowdfunding campaigns go south because of overspending. We left a safety margin for us, and we minimized the expenses.
All summed up: 

We checked out, and analysed all mayor crowdfunding campaigns which run into problems. We are confident we will not make the same mistakes, and we can make AVOC happen. We set our delivery date to December, as we wanted to keep at least two months reserve, and we are confident to deliver by then. The same goes for our $200 000 campaign goal. Sure, $100 000 would look better, but then there wouldn't be any reserve should anything happen. We will also keep our spendings as open as possible, and keep you informed!


  THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP
We got this far on our own, but we can't proceed without standing on the shoulders of giants.Now we need You to help us get AVOC to off the ground!
 Q&AWhy is the AVOC special? Why should I buy it?First of all AVOC is cheap. On Indiegogo you can get it for 139$, but for this price you get the fastest 3D printer from its price range. Moreover the building volume is more than 3 litre. In addition you get a brand new and unique interface, which is easy to use.How is this speed possible?We know that you don't 
want to wait hours for the printed piece, so to reach this speed AVOC 
uses the right motors for the job. It also has many other advanced 
solutions to speed up the process.Why is it so cheap?We don't use unnecessary things in the AVOC, just essential things and materials to make a safe, fast, and reliable printer.When will I get the product?According to our plans the AVOC will be shipped at the end of the year, so you can put your AVOC under the Christmas tree.You mentioned the new interface. What is it about?Our
 programmers are working on a brand new interface for everybody. This 
means that it will be simple, so beginners can use it too, 
but it will have the possibility for the advanced users to change the 
settings.Does the AVOC need anything special in the house or on the computer?No you just need a socket and a computer and the spirit to print something.I am not an expert in assembling. Do I have to do anything special with the AVOC when it arrives?No it is plug and play. Just plug it into an electric outlet, do a basic set-up and and it is ready to use.What kind of material does AVOC use to print?AVOC 
can use almost every common printing materials which is non-flexible. It
 is pretty easy to get these materials from the internet or 3D printing 
shops.Is AVOC safe?Yes. It has a completely enclosed 
build area, so it’s safe for operation. (We tested it in cats, they 
couldn’t get inside.) In addition AVOC using low voltage components, and
 full RGB LEDs are indicating if the nozzle is hot.What source file can AVOC use?The printer accepts standard g-code, like any other printers. The GUI accepts.stl files.How much does shipping cost? It depends on where you live. We are still negotiating with shipping companies, so we will try to ship for the lowest possible price.How much does VAT, and duty cost? Most of the time 3D printers are duty free (at least in the EU). The recipient is responsible to pay VAT, and duty, if applies.

story:
Charlie Button simplifies your already complicated life with simple and easy to use macro buttons for your smartphone. Just specify your most commonly used functions and with a click, it's done. Charlie Button can be assigned a total of nine functions using three modes and three buttons.


Add a little 'simple' to your life, Charlie will help you.

Charlie Button can be used at home or in the office and is compatible with any Bluetooth enabled device. It can attached to your cell phone, wearables, key rings, etc. and can be used by anyone, anywhere. It's your companion wherever you go.


Home, Office, Dates, etc.


This is a day in the life of Charlie. Shall we take a closer look?


Good morning! Now that you've opened your eyes, what's the first thing you do? Is it perhaps looking for your smartphone? Stop playing hide and seek with your cell phone and press Charlie Button!



You're on your way to work. What's the first thing you do? Startup your navigation? Call in to let them know you're on the way? You can complete all these tasks with Charlie Button. Stop wasting time when on the road!


Charlie Button helps you in the office as well! You can register multiple devices allowing simultaneous notifications to be sent out to your team. No more meetings starting late because your team forgot, right?


Sometimes meeting run too quickly and writing everything down can be cumbersome. Charlie Button can even record your meetings for you so you can go back and take notes later!


Even after a long day and you're meeting your significant other, Charlie Button is there with you. Share your location with each other or even take a quick selfie.

Use Charlie Button as protection as well! If you're in a tough spot and need help, Charlie Button will request help from those around you by sending out alerts to registered users in your app. Did you have a nice day with Charlie Button? Just wait until tomorrow!

Charlie’s infinite abilities

You can easily execute these functions with our Charlie Button app


Charlie uses a mount system so as long as you have holders, it can be sheathed anywhere. Use Charlie freely!


*Wearable will be available if our stretch goals are met!





First, launch the application from your smartphone. Select the desired function and wait for the button to change color and press Next. Press Charlie Button once to complete setup. Simple isn't it?





Charlie Button is extremely portable, but we had to think about preventing loss when designing our product along with other concerns. We wanted a way to easily attach and detach Charlie from devices without relying on adhesives. This is why we have a separate holder that allows simply mounting on each of your devices.


Charlie Button is a macro button device that utilizes Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) and is compatible with any iOS and Android device and will continue to be updated as other Bluetooth devices come out on the market. Charlie doesn't rely on 1:1 pairing and can connect to multiple devices all while using a single coin battery that will last more than 3 years.



Charlie Button comes with 3 buttons. However, we didn't want to stop with just a single function per button. Therefore we added 3 modes per button adding up to potentially 9 functions per mode. You can have modes set depending on which environment you're in (home, car, office, etc.).


Future development plans

We have already begun expanding Charlie Button's functionality and plan on making Charlie Button work with your household lights, radios, etc.and we already have a prototype working that controls your lights!



Charlie needs your help! If we are able to meet our stretch goals, we'll be able to provide additional perks as well as develop a compatible wearable band.




IMA Inc. is a company that is passionate about new products that address the paradigms between the digital and analog generation through IT convergence. We promise to provide quality service with a commitment to producing the best products we can and facing any challenges that we come across diligently. 

Why are we crowdfunding?

We set out with the goal of developing smarter technology to match the changing world around us. No more wasting time trying to find functions on your phone or getting simple tasks done at the office. With Charlie Button in my hands, we will strive to add additional functions. In order to include more features and continue developing we need your help.


Risks & Challenges

We are committed in providing a faultless product and will work towards finishing everything as scheduled. But there may be unforeseen modifications or delays and hope that you will understand if issues arise.


FAQ

1. Are actions executed the same for iOS and Android?

Because iOS has more restrictions, actions cannot be performed directly from Charlie Button. Once a button is pressed, you will receive a notification that will execute your action once opened. For Android devices, the function is executed immediately with the click of a button.

2. What is Charlie Button's range?

Charlie Button's range is roughly 150 feet.

3. Will Charlie Button work if my screen is locked?

For iOS devices, you will receive a notification on your screen. Once the notification is opened, the function will be performed. For Android devices, this is an option. Functions can be shown as notifications or executed directly.

4. What are modes and buttons?

Charlie Button is separated into 3 modes using 3 buttons each. This means you have a total of 9 functions available at your fingertips.

5. How do I use it as a wearable?

Charlie Button was designed to have two parts: a holder and device. Wherever there's a holder you can use Charlie Button. We are planning on  having compatible keyrings and watch wristbands available as well.

6.  Is it possible to register multiple Charlie Buttons on one device?

Because Charlie Button does not require 1:1 pairing, you can have multiple buttons for one device. However, for security purposes we limited the number of Charlie Buttons for one device to 4.

7. Would you like to partner with us?

Send us a message anytime and we will get back to you.

8. What is the battery life?

The average battery life for one Charlie Button is 3-5 years.
